agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE HEALTH CONNECTION CLINIC - SULLIVAN COUNTY
service_description: Provides free weatherization for eligible moderate- to low-income homeowners and renters. Services include an energy audit, installing insulation, reducing air infiltration, performing heating tune-ups, and when necessary, replacing faculty units. Applications are accepted at local offices during energy assistance seasons.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Daviess, Greene, Knox, or Sullivan County --Living in the home (either as an owner or a renter) -- With household income at or below 200% federal poverty guidelines and/or receiving SSI or TANF -- Priority given to applicants who are elderly, have disabilities, or have children under age 18

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE HEALTH CONNECTION CLINIC - SULLIVAN COUNTY
service_description: Provides access to reproductive health services, including physical exams, birth control, pregnancy testing and verification, Pap tests, testing and treatment for sexually transmitted diseases/infections, and HIV testing. Services for both men and women.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment -OR- walk in.
site_schedule: Mon 9am-noon and 1pm-5:30pm; Tues and Wed 8am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides free or low-cost flu vaccinations to Sullivan County residents beginning in mid-October until the supply is depleted.
site_details: Walk-ins accepted during clinic hours; appointment preferred.
site_eligibility: Living in Sullivan County -- Uninsured, with insurance that does not cover vaccine, receiving Medicaid

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations for tetanus, hepatitis, pneumonia and flu shots (available seasonally). Fees vary by vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or availability of walk-ins.
site_eligibility: Age 19 and older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations for tetanus, hepatitis, pneumonia and flu shots (available seasonally). Fees vary by vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or availability of walk-ins.
site_eligibility: Age 19 and older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Sullivan County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, and air or water pollution. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a quarterly support group for persons with diabetes and their support persons. Topics include meal planning, medications, exercise, and lifestyle issues.
site_details: Call for registration or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Persons of any age diagnosed with diabetes and their support persons

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Delivers daily meals for fixed fees. Clients may choose to receive a hot lunch, a sack dinner, or both. Diabetic, calorie-controlled, low-sodium, and other therapeutic meals are available. Limited service area. Volunteers welcome.
site_details: Call to enroll.
site_eligibility: Living in Sullivan County

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from Sullivan County Community Hospital. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. Call the switchboard and ask for a Financial Counselor to request a Financial Assistance Application.
site_eligibility: Received medically necessary health care services from Sullivan County Community Hospital (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income (Those below 200% of Federal Poverty Level may be eligible for free care.)

site_details: Call for schedule information and class registration. Be prepared to provide due date, doctor's name, hospital of delivery, and contact information.
site_eligibility: Expectant parents

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Sullivan County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Sullivan County.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Sullivan County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Sullivan County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Sullivan County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Sullivan County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Sullivan County

This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services to the city of Sullivan.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities, including the city pool, and programming in the city of Sullivan in Sullivan County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and soup kitchen.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Pull up to the kitchen door to receive food basket.
site_eligibility: Living in Shelburn -- Not used this pantry in the past 30 days

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a meal site.

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides transportation to medical appointments for area veterans to the veterans' hospital in Indianapolis, Indiana. Vehicle is not wheelchair accessible.
site_details: Call or email for more information or to request transportation.
site_eligibility: Veterans living in Sullivan County -- With an appointment at the veterans' hospital in Indianapolis, Indiana

agency_desc: A 24-hour crisis intervention agency that provides inpatient and outpatient behavioral health care; mental health and addictions treatment for all ages.
service_name: OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES - SULLIVAN COUNTY
service_description: Provides individual, group, couple, and family counseling for adults, adolescents, and children. Also offers psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office for information or to a schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment) -- Living in Clay, Sullivan, or Vigo county
